channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Mixed as China Stocks Enjoy Best Day Since 2008
item.description: The S&P 500 and Dow industrials inched lower, after the Dow closed at a record high on Friday. The Nasdaq Composite ticked up.

item.title: How Nvidia's Monster Rally Broke Your Tech ETF
item.description: With several $3 trillion companies in a single sector, S&P was forced to change its index-weighting rules.

item.title: The $1,000 'Micro' Handbags Luxury Brands Are Pinning Their Hopes On
item.description: To spot a potential comeback story in the luxury goods industry, look for the brand with the smallest handbags.

item.title: Natural Gas Rises on West Coast Heat, Storm Watches
item.description: Natural gas was up 0.5% with heat in the West expected to drive up demand for air conditioning and three tropical systems active in the Atlantic Ocean...

item.title: Eurozone economy is facing ‘headwinds,’ European Central Bank’s Lagarde says
item.description: The European economy is facing headwinds amid subdued activity in the region’s manufacturing base, ECB President Christine Lagarde said on Monday.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock pares losses and remains on track for yet another monthly gain
item.description: Nvidia’s stock fell again on Monday but remained on track for another monthly gain, as Wall Street continued to tout the semiconductor maker as a driv...

item.title: GM’s and Ford’s stocks drop after Jeep owner Stellantis cuts profit-margin view
item.description: Stellantis warns of more intense competition from China.

item.title: 14 energy stocks whose ample cash flow might benefit shareholders
item.description: Favored names expected to continue gushing cash include Devon, Halliburton and Schlumberger.

item.title: Amazon Prime Video’s ad event beat targets. That’s good news for the stock, says BofA.
item.description: Amazon.com Inc.’s streaming video service drew more than $1.8 billion in advertising commitments from last week’s upfront event, exceeding the company...

item.title: Euro's Strength Might Lose Momentum Until Next Year
item.description: The euro is unlikely to rise much further against the dollar in the near term as expectations for Fed and ECB interest-rate cuts are fully priced for ...
